commentTextItems.html: on the off stump and fuller in length, Mashrafe comes down the track and lofts it straight down the throat of Sohail Tanvir at long off to hand over the match to Pakistan

commentPostTextItems.html: The fact that the tenth wicket was the highest partnership in the innings speaks volumes about the miserable batting performance by Bangladesh. The sad part in all this is this capitulation is not the first time. Time and time again we have seen the batsmen throw their wicket away before getting accustomed to the wicket. No one remembers the last time Bangladesh ran a test playing nation close. Whats more  saddening is that the batsmen dont seem to mend their ways, which always puts the bowlers performances into the background.
Something needs to be done about the way Bangladesh cricket or else it would be all downhill from here
Yousuf has been awarded the Man of the match award for his unbeaten century and thanks almighty for his innings and also remembers to thank the team trainer for the fitness levels.
Ashraful, Bangladesh captain laments the lack of the third seamer in the team and believes that the batsmen are doing well.
Malik, Pakistan captain thanks Bangladesh team for making the trip at the last moment and compliments his bowlers for rising up to the occasion
Please join us for the Second ODI  from Faisalabad on Friday, April 11th at 10:00 GMT
Till then it is good night from all of us at Cricinfo

dismissalText.commentary: Aftab Ahmed c Kamran Akmal b Sohail Tanvir 14 (32b 1x4 0x6 49m) SR: 43.75

dismissalComment.html: on the off stump, Aftab comes down the track and looks to loft it away on the off side but gets an outside edge back to the keeper, Akmal who pouches it. What got into Aftab's mind as he was batting pretty well but he throws it all away

dismissalText.long: b Iftikhar Anjum
dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Ashraful b Iftikhar Anjum 9 (19b 1x4 0x6 39m) SR: 47.36

dismissalComment.html: on the off stump and slower in pace, Ashraful looks to pull it away on the leg side or rather more a swish and misses it and turns back to see the wood work rearranged. This is talent throwing it away, how many times did we say this about Ashraful and he needs to be accountable for all his silly shots

dismissalText.long: c Kamran Akmal b Shoaib Malik
dismissalText.commentary: Raqibul Hasan c Kamran Akmal b Shoaib Malik 12 (40b 1x4 0x6 58m) SR: 30

dismissalComment.html: on the off stump and Raqibul, who has been scrapping around for a while gets an inside edge onto his pads and the ball bobs up from the pads as Akmal comes diving forward and takes a one handed catch. Quite an acrobatic effort that by Akmal and it is refreshing to watch

stories.title: Yousuf ton sets up thumping win
stories.subTitle: Pakistan v Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Lahore
stories.summary: A fine hundred from Mohammad Yousuf and a plucky 85 from Shoaib Malik set up Pakistan's mammoth 322 before the bowlers sealed a thumping 152-run win in the first ODI in Lahore
